page.title: 01SECTION OF COLL COASTLINE
page.content: This block contains a section of the SE coast of the isle of Coll in the Inner Hebrides. The percentage of land in the block is twenty percent. The sea included in the block is part of thr passage between Coll and Mull. the land is almost worthless bog, peat, rock and heather, where sheep from Gallawach farm on the north west coast of Coll are grazed in small numbers. the history of the island shows that this section of Coll was inhabited by people who scratched a living fishing and working the rough ground. Some evidence of early nineteenth century houses are still to be found which were evacuated during the highland clearances. Some birds nest on the shore but this inhospitable environment supports very little wildlife.
